trans-unit.source: Contains a sequential list of role groups that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView"></xref> control uses to determine which control template to display to users based on their role.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroupCollection> class manages the list of role groups associated with a particular <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> template.
Each role group defines the content and controls to display to a particular group of users on your Web site.
It is possible to assign several role groups to the same template.

To find the role group in the collection that a particular user belongs to, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroupCollection.GetMatchingRoleGroup%2A> method to search the collection by user name.
The order of the roles in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroupCollection> collection is important because matching is done sequentially based on the first role found.
You must configure role management to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroupCollection> class to manage a list of role groups.
For more information, see [Understanding Role Management](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/a0d2f19d-a2a7-496d-88b6-30133f8ea3d6).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroupCollection"></xref> class.
Adds a role group to the end of the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup"></xref> to add to the collection.
Indicates whether the collection contains the specified role group.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup"></xref> to look for in the collection.
`true` if the specified role group is a member of the collection; otherwise `false`.

Copies all the items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroupCollection"></xref> collection to a compatible one-dimensional array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup"></xref> objects, starting at the specified index in the target array.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroupCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the contents of the collection into the specified zero-based array.
Items are copied starting at the specified index of the target array.
After the items are in an array, you can use array syntax to access the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroupCollection> collection.
A zero-based array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup"></xref> objects that receives the items copied from the collection.
The position in the target array at which the array starts receiving the copied items.
Returns the first role group that contains the specified user account.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroupCollection.GetMatchingRoleGroup%2A> method searches the role group collection and returns the first role group that contains the specified user account.
The method searches the collection in the order role groups are added to the collection, and returns only the first matching role group.
If the specified user account is not part of any of the role groups in the collection, `null` is returned.
You must configure role management to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroupCollection.GetMatchingRoleGroup%2A> method.
For more information, see [Understanding Role Management](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/a0d2f19d-a2a7-496d-88b6-30133f8ea3d6).
An <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal"></xref> that represents the user account to find the role group collection.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup"></xref> representing the first role group in the collection that contains the specified user account.
If the user is not part of a role group in the collection, it returns `null`.
user is `null`.
Searches the collection and returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroupCollection.IndexOf%2A> method performs a linear search; therefore the average execution time depends on the number of members in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup"></xref> to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of the first occurrence of group within the entire , if found; otherwise, -1.
Adds a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup"></xref> to the collection at the specified index.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroupCollection.Insert%2A> method inserts the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup> at the specified location.
Role groups that follow the insertion point move down in the collection to accommodate the new element.
The zero-based index at which to insert the role group.
The role group to insert.
Gets the role group at the specified index.
The index of the role group to return.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup"></xref> at the specified index.
Deletes the first occurrence of the specified role group from the collection.
The first instance of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup> object is removed from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroupCollection> collection.
Groups that follow the removed group all move up in the index to fill the vacated spot.
If there is more than one instance of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup> object, only the first instance is removed.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup"></xref> to remove from the collection.
